lexUnit.name: preach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deliver a religious address to an assembled group of people.

sentence.text: ` All that trust , and honour and integrity you preach about -- the last two you might have a surfeit of , but the first one ?
Make him practise what he preaches .
The first comes at his baptism , the second at the first sermon he preached ( Mark 1:11 , Luke 4:18 ) .
" To him " , preached Peter , " all the prophets bear witness , that every one who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name . "
Then , having assembled the people , and by the king 's order , they preached about believing in one God and spurning pagan superstitions .
In 1802 , already a minister for ten years , she set out to preach to ` Ethiopia 's children " living under ` base tyranny " in ` the large cities of America " .
For instance , in November 1990 two brothers in Abbotabad were each sentenced to six years ' imprisonment and given a heavy fine for having preached about their faith .
However , on the eve of the referendum , the majority of priests preached against abortion .
Some also held field meetings at which they preached against bishops and the Government .
Such moderate pragmatism is a world away from the moral absolutism usually preached by business ethicists .
What is known of his life comes mainly from a memorial sermon preached by his friend and successor as bishop , George Rust , and from his own books .
How couldst thou preach of heaven and hell in such a careless , sleepy manner ?
Doc Paisley was the first man I ever heard preach to me directly that I was sinner , that God loved me and that Jesus died for me …
But if he has n't seen that he ca n't go round preaching to other people about their morals .
Rikky : ` I think hedonism 's the one thing bands should be preaching , if they must ` preach " anything at all . "
The periodic appearance of literate philosophers who preach the equality of man is thus itself a kind of paradox .
The building was dedicated by the President of the Church , the Reverend Ernest Shaw , and the sermon was preached by the ex-President , the Reverend Dr R M L Waugh .
As early as 1566 , the Earl of Sussex had pointed out that Calvinism was being preached throughout the country , and after 1570 it was difficult to hear or read any non-Calvinist theology .
Michel Montignac preaches that you can eat fabulously well while losing weight .
So Rose preaches endurance and strength , focus and discipline of the kind that lets The Amazing Mr Lifto pierce his nipples and suspend a chain and concrete block from them .
He may preach the virtues of an empty bank account , but Damon is fairly obsessed with filling his own .
John Knox preached the reformed faith in Leith .
More than 50 adults arrested and 140 children taken in for questioning after raids across France on outlawed Children of God sect which preaches free love for all ages .
His family doctor has given up preaching restraint .
After the music , Les would preach a short sermon , say a prayer , then he and his girlfriend would serve tea and biscuits .
